com.jakewharton.rxrelay2

Class BehaviorRelay<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.reactivex.Observable<T>
      • com.jakewharton.rxrelay2.Relay<T>
        • com.jakewharton.rxrelay2.BehaviorRelay<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<T>, io.reactivex.ObservableSource<T>

    public final class BehaviorRelay<T>
extends Relay<T>
    Relay that emits the most recent item it has observed and all subsequent observed items to each subscribed Observer.

    Example usage: 

     

  // observer will receive all events.
  BehaviorRelay<Object> subject = BehaviorRelay.create("default");
  subject.subscribe(observer);
  subject.accept("one");
  subject.accept("two");
  subject.accept("three");

  // observer will receive the "one", "two" and "three" events, but not "zero"
  BehaviorRelay<Object> subject = BehaviorRelay.create("default");
  subject.accept("zero");
  subject.accept("one");
  subject.subscribe(observer);
  subject.accept("two");
  subject.accept("three");

        public static <T> BehaviorRelay<T> createDefault(T defaultValue)
        Creates a BehaviorRelay that emits the last item it observed and all subsequent items to each Observer that subscribes to it.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the item that will be emitted first to any Observer as long as the BehaviorRelay has not yet observed any items from its source Observable

        The method is thread-safe.

      • getValues

        public Object[] getValues()
        Returns an Object array containing snapshot all values of the Relay.

        The method is thread-safe.

      • getValues

        public T[] getValues(T[] array)
        Returns a typed array containing a snapshot of all values of the Relay.

        The method follows the conventions of Collection.toArray by setting the array element after the last value to null (if the capacity permits).

        The method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        array - the target array to copy values into if it fits

      • hasValue

        public boolean hasValue()
        Returns true if the subject has any value.

        The method is thread-safe.

        Returns:
        true if the subject has any value
